text: hi everyone
snaptony back tano here the internet's
busiest music nerd and it's time for a
review of this new bicep album
isles this is a brand new lp of
material from uk electronic music duo
bicep whose self-titled record in 2017
handily stopped me in my tracks with its
subtle presentation but also
irresistible grooves the track list was
a diverse series of house variants that
all flowed pretty cohesively thanks to
their
cerebral ambiance in other words this
album was equally danceable
and deep with some occasional bold
touches of color
so i was hoping for a similar balance of
sounds on this new lp
but came away slightly disappointed
after
hearing that the material here is
leaning in a slightly more ambient
direction
which isn't necessarily a bad thing in
concept sure the drums and pads on this
thing aren't nearly as textured or as
bold as they were several years ago but
that could easily be made up for
with structures and compositions that
are maybe more intricate
adventurous abstract that would
certainly be something to chew over
but sadly most of the material here
features a very solid simple assembly
and utterly unremarkable sound
now i will give it to isles that the
increase in space
and atmosphere does occasionally lead to
a moment that feels both dreamy and
larger than life
take the title track which features
these glossy distant lead vocals that
call out angelically
against these fragmented gentle beats
the gaps between these elements
eventually being filled out by these
very airy pads and also
darting chirping angular synth sequences
that are quite sharp
structurally the track does drift off
for a moment around the midpoint then
comes back harder
it presents a vibe that you sort of get
lost in and i don't mind doing so
then the track apricots is mostly led by
these bright infectious vocal samples
that are
chopped up really aggressively the piece
hits a brisk
pace right away which is only
intensified by the building synthesizers
and drums underneath
the beat that eventually drops around
the midpoint isn't
exactly a banger but it's just enough to
lock me into the deeply hypnotic
qualities of the track so far
then reaver does feature one of the
bulkier beats on the entire record but
don't let the increased
volume fool you structurally this one is
going nowhere in
a hurry the dreamy chorus vocal samples
on the front end of the track are the
most stunning moment it has to offer and
it's pretty much downhill from there
even with some of the building tones
layering throughout much of the track
which
ultimately sound like what you would get
if you had john hopkins
dishing out some two-step rhythms but
with a lot less thrust
the track sundial leaves a lot to be
desired too
as the punchy busy rhythms don't really
make up for the bland
tones that hang overhead ultimately
there's nothing terrible about the track
but it doesn't change the fact that it's
about as thrilling as watching a puddle
evaporate in the hot sun
lido i am mostly stunned by as it sounds
like a chilly piano piece from an old
school rpg
that might play in the midst of me
reading dense blocks of npc text
explaining the origins of the ice temple
that i'm about to fight my way out of
the track does have a pretty vibe but it
doesn't exactly fit in with the rest of
the record in my opinion
then there's x featuring clara lasanne
and
what even is this the track almost feels
like a parody of idm with its
ridiculously angular
springy thin base then also these
cascading
senselessly swirling synthesizer
arpeggios
just folding over each other in a really
awkward way the whole thing
sounds like a tuna casserole just
melting with
gooey orange cheese and it makes me
a little queasy then to speak on the
project's final moments the
song fur has a mostly inoffensive first
leg but at least it builds up to an
epic shimmering dense finish it reminds
me almost like a
i don't know a blank mass track if it
were to
be a lot less experimental in
presentation just very thick
very layered very linear but not any
real bite to it then the closing track
hawk does have its moments but it's far
from being a climactic finish glossy
pads along with some sputtering beats
essentially provide a foundation for
these revving synth leads that sound
like
a formula one car's whizzing by which i
suppose
is an interesting contrast but it's not
one the duo really develops into
anything beyond what you might hear in
the first minute or so of the song
it loses steam pretty fast like with
many
tracks on this thing so yeah overall i
guess i'm
pretty let down by this one as agreeable
and as pleasant as i found many of the
tracks here to be
the decrease in colorful and textured
instrumentation was a letdown
and the effect of there being a lack of
adventure on that front
was only worsened by the progressions
and compositions here
being so predictable and uninspired
sadly i'm feeling a strong five to a
light six
on this one tran position have you given
this one a listen did you love it did
you hate it what would you rate it
you're the best you're the best what
should i review next
hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell
as well over here next to my head is
another video that you can check out hit
that up worthy link to subscribe to the
channel
anthony fantano bicep forever
